author: George Hughes
title: Tragic: Young Woman, 20, Dies as Blood 'Oozes from Her Eyes' After Being Misdiagnosed
text:
A heartrending inquest has brought to light significant delays in emergency care that may have cost the life of a promising young woman. The inquiry centered on the tragic death of 20-year-old Sophie Ward, whose sudden decline occurred just one day after receiving reassurance that she did not have meningitis,... according to the Daily Star.
Sophie, described by those who knew her as "admired for her tenderness, sincerity, and kindness," initially alerted her family to her deteriorating condition when she informed her mum that she was shivering and running a high temperature. Acting on advice from the 111 service, she was rushed to Barnet Hospital, where the situation quickly turned dire. According to testimony at the inquest, Sophie's arrival at the A&E department was met with what witnesses called a "chaotic" environment, exacerbating an already critical situation.
Initial assessments indicated that her symptoms could be consistent with meningitis—a life-threatening condition if not treated promptly. However, it later emerged that she was seen by medical staff a full two hours after her arrival. In hindsight, evidence presented at the inquest suggested that she should have been attended to within 15 minutes, a crucial window that could have made all the…
George Hughes

author: Réseau International
title: Las autoridades de Gaza acusan a Israel de robar órganos de cuerpos palestinos
text: - apoyo Réseau International Te necesitamos por Nour Abou Eisha Las autoridades locales de Gaza acusaron a Israel el martes por la noche de robar órganos de cuerpos palestinos y pidieron una investigación internacional sobre el asunto. En un comunicado, la oficina de medios del gobierno con sede en Gaza dijo que el examen de los cuerpos reveló que sus formas habían cambiado significativamente debido al robo de órganos vitales de los cadáveres. Añadió que el ejército israelí había entregado cadáveres no identificados a las autoridades palestinas y se negó a especificar dónde fueron encontrados. La misma fuente también indicó que el ejército israelí repitió tal acto durante la guerra en curso contra Gaza y también exhumó cuerpos de los cementerios. El comunicado de prensa critica lo que dice “la postura silenciosa de las organizaciones internacionales que operan en Gaza, incluido el Comité Internacional de la Cruz Roja, ante un crimen tan horrendo cometido por la ocupación (israelí)". Las autoridades israelíes aún no se han pronunciado sobre estas acusaciones. El martes, las autoridades israelíes entregaron los cuerpos de decenas de palestinos asesinados por el ejército israelí y detenidos durante su operación terrestre. El Ministerio de Salud de Gaza recibió los cuerpos a través del cruce fronterizo de Kerem Shalom en el sur de la Franja de Gaza, dijo un corresponsal de Gaza.Anadolu sur le terrain. El Ministerio de Dotaciones y Asuntos Religiosos de Gaza fue responsable de su entierro en fosas comunes, informó el corresponsal. «La ONU nos avisó con antelación de la llegada de un número de mártires a la Franja de Gaza, estimado en unos 80 cadáveres“, dijo a Anadolu Marwan Al-Hams, director del hospital Mohammed Yousef El-Najar de la ciudad de Rafah. «Los cuerpos llegaron en un contenedor, algunos intactos, otros en pedazos y otros en estado de descomposición.Él agregó. fuente: [Agencia Anadolu](https://www.aa.com.tr/fr/monde/les-autorit%C3%A9s-de-gaza-accusent-isra%C3%ABl-de-voler-les-organes-des-corps-de-palestiniens/3093341)

author: sync
title: مصدر أمني: السيطرة على حريق محدود نشب أعلى سنترال رمسيس
text:
صرح مصدر أمني مسئول بأن قوات الحماية المدنية بالقاهرة، تمكنت من السيطرة على حريق محدود نشب أعلى مبنى سنترال رمسيس دون وقوع أي خسائر بشرية.
مصدر أمني: إخماد حريق محدود في سنترال رمسيس
وكانت تجددت النيران، منذ قليل، مساء اليوم الخميس، أعلى مبنى سنترال رمسيس بوسط القاهرة، بعد ساعات من السيطرة على الحريق الهائل الذي اندلع في الطابق السابع من المبنى مساء الإثنين، وأسفر عن مصرع 4 موظفين وإصابة ما لا يقل عن 33 شخصًا بينهم عناصر من قوات الحماية المدنية.
ونقدم لكم من خلال موقع ( فيتو )، تغطية ورصدًا مستمرًّا على مدار الـ 24 ساعة لـ أسعار الذهب ، أسعار اللحوم ، أسعار الدولار ، أسعار اليورو ، أسعار العملات ، أخبار الرياضة ، أخبار مصر ، أخبار اقتصاد ، أخبار المحافظات ، أخبار السياسة ، أخبار الحوداث ، ويقوم فريقنا بمتابعة حصرية لجميع الدوريات العالمية مثل الدوري الإنجليزي ، الدوري الإيطالي ، الدوري المصري ، دوري أبطال أوروبا ، دوري أبطال أفريقيا ، دوري أبطال آسيا ، والأحداث الهامة و السياسة الخارجية والداخلية بالإضافة للنقل الحصري لـ أخبار الفن والعديد من الأنشطة الثقافية والأدبية.
تابع موقع فيتو عبر قناة (يوتيوب) اضغط ه نا
تابع موقع فيتو عبر قناة (واتساب) اضغط ه نا
تابع موقع فيتو عبر تطبيق (نبض) اضغط ه نا
تابع موقع فيتو عبر تطبيق (جوجل نيوز) اضغط ه نا

author: @RevistaISTOE
title: Pintado não perde a confiança no Guarani apesar do jejum na Série B: ‘Não vamos nos entregar’
text:
25/07/2024 - 18:55
A situação do Guarani segue complicada na Série B do Campeonato Brasileiro. Nesta quarta-feira, chegou a 13 jogos seguidos sem vitória, ao empatar com o Amazonas, por 1 a 1, fora de casa, em Manaus. Apesar da igualdade, o técnico Pintado disse que viu evolução na equipe bugrina neste duelo e afirmou que o clube irá lutar para se salvar desse rebaixamento até o fim.
“Esse momento é um momento importante de somar pontos para nós. Não podemos esquecer que tem um caminho longo pela frente para pensar em recuperação, mas o que fica claro hoje é uma equipe que não se entrega. Não vai se entregar em momento nenhum. Isso é muito claro para nós”, disse o treinador.
Atualmente, após 17 rodadas disputadas, o Guarani somou apenas oito pontos e amarga a lanterna da tabela da Série C. Está 11 pontos atrás da Chapecoense, primeiro time fora da zona de rebaixamento, que tem 19. De qualquer forma, Pintado aproveitou para reclamar do VAR no lance do gol de empate marcado por Sassá.
“Eu não gosto de falar da arbitragem, mas a gente fica preocupado com os critérios que estão sendo para o Guarani de uma maneira diferente do que a gente aprende e ouve da arbitragem”, completou.
Agora, o Guarani volta a campo no próximo domingo, quando faz um duelo direto contra o Brusque, no estádio Brinco de Ouro, às 20h, em Campinas. O rival também está na zona de rebaixamento.

author: Nico DeMattia
title: California Bill Would Electronically Cap Vehicle Speed to 10 MPH Over Limit
text: California Bill Would Electronically Cap Vehicle Speed to 10 MPH Over Limit If passed, every new vehicle sold in the Golden State in 2027 would have a top speed of 80 mph—road permitting. Everyone wants safer roads. However, California senator Scott Wiener wants "SAFER" roads, as that's the name of the bill he proposed, which would electronically cap a new vehicle's top speed to 10 mph over the [speed limit](https://www.thedrive.com/news/new-york-seeks-to-increase-its-highway-speed-limit), among other things. Part of the Speeding and Fatality Emergency Reduction on California Streets (SAFER California Streets) bill published Tuesday would require all vehicles built starting in 2027 to have speed governors. As proposed, they'd work using a vehicle's GPS compared with a database of posted speed limits, though speed limit sign recognition would seem to present another method. The [text of SB-961](https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billNavClient.xhtml?bill_id=202320240SB961) mentions that the electronic regulator "shall only be capable of being temporarily disabled by the driver of the vehicle," but doesn't explain in what circumstances a driver should or will be allowed to do that. Other road changes in the bill include side underride guards on trucks, to reduce the risk of cars and bikes being pulled underneath in a crash; improved crosswalks; and curb extensions. These new rules are designed to counter a rise in reckless driving since the pandemic. According to TRIP, a national transportation research nonprofit, traffic casualties in California rose 22% from 2019 to 2022, and 4,400 Californians died in traffic accidents in 2022. "The alarming surge in road deaths is unbearable and demands an urgent response," said Senator Wiener in a [news release](https://sd11.senate.ca.gov/news/20240124-senator-wiener-introduces-groundbreaking-bills-slash-california-road-deaths-epidemic). "There is no reason for anyone to be going over 100 miles per hour on a public road, yet in 2020, California Highway Patrol issued over 3,000 tickets for just that offense. Preventing reckless speeding is a commonsense approach to prevent these utterly needless and heartbreaking crashes." There will be obvious questions about government overreach with such a bill, as it allows Johnny Law to reach his hand into your car and hold your pedal back. However, Wiener disagrees with that view. "I don't think it's at all an overreach, and I don't think most people would view it as an overreach, we have speed limits, I think most people support speed limits because people know that speed kills," he told [ABC 7.](https://abc7news.com/scott-wiener-speed-governors-pedestrian-safety-california-bills-streets-safer/14356386/) Wiener added that no one needs to go more than 10 mph over the speed limit unless they're in emergency vehicles, which are exempt from the bill. Naturally, there's going to be pushback on such a proposal, from both those fearful of government meddling and car enthusiasts alike. I'm also interested to hear what automakers think about the plan. You'd figure Porsche might have a harder time selling [911 Turbos](https://www.thedrive.com/new-cars/32936/2021-porsche-911-turbo-s-review-a-champion-emerges-in-the-best-911-yet) electronically restricted to 80 mph, as that [doesn't really get the blood pumping](https://www.thedrive.com/news/bad-behavior-in-car-ads-is-getting-some-government-scrutiny). Hopefully the GPS would know to switch the finger-wagging off at a designated racetrack. Got tips? Send 'em to tips@thedrive.com

author: Admin
title: Unlocking New Zealand’s Wonders With Warm Welcome to US, European, and Polish Citizens
text:
New Zealand Online Visa is delighted to unveil substantial enhancements to its visa program, ensuring seamless access for global travelers. These updates reflect a commitment to strengthening international relations, promoting tourism, and enhancing the overall efficiency and accessibility of the visa application process. The initiative seeks to provide a more convenient and welcoming pathway for travelers from diverse corners of the globe to experience the beauty, culture, and opportunities that New Zealand has to offer.
To provide comprehensive information to prospective travelers, the
New Zealand Visa FAQ addresses frequently asked questions related to the visa application process. These NZeTA questions aim to offer clarity on essential aspects such as eligibility criteria, required documentation, processing times, and any recent updates to the visa program. By proactively addressing common queries, New Zealand Online Visa aims to empower travelers with the knowledge needed to navigate the application process with ease, ensuring a smooth and hassle-free experience. Whether it understands specific visa types, entry requirements, or application timelines, the FAQ section serves as a valuable resource for individuals planning their journey to New Zealand.
New Zealand warmly welcomes citizens of the US, Europe, and Poland to explore its breathtaking landscapes and vibrant culture. Travelers from these nations can now easily obtain a New Zealand visa, unlocking opportunities to experience the country’s natural beauty and rich heritage. A
New Zealand Visa for US citizens, a New Zealand Visa for European citizens, and a New Zealand Visa for Poland Citizens are not optional, but a mandatory requirement for all these citizens traveling to the country for short stays. Before traveling to New Zealand, a traveler needs to ensure that the validity of the passport is at least three months past the expected departure date.
Travelers can apply for the ETA online or through authorized agents without visiting the New Zealand Embassy. Unlike a visa, making an appointment or presenting the original documents at the Embassy or any New Zealand electronic travel authority is unnecessary. However, this privilege does not apply to all nationalities. There are about 60 countries that are eligible to enter New Zealand with the ETA approval, including these citizens.
This rule is in effect from 1st October 2019 for travelers to apply in advance and get approval through ETA or a regular visa to visit the country. NZeTA aims to screen travelers before they arrive for border and immigration risks and enable smooth border crossing. The rules are almost similar to the ESTA though the eligible countries differ.
These improvements are in line with New Zealand’s mission to support international travel, encourage cross-cultural interactions, and streamline the visa application process for tourists from all over the world. Explore the nation’s varied topography, energetic metropolises, and hospitable localities as you seek out life-changing adventures.
